Articles.Content:
![470_25109_473085.jpg](http://www.sinaimg.cn/dy/slidenews/8_img/2015_11/470_25109_473085.jpg)

It looks... magnificient ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

This is a full LM-5, all real parts but under a vibration test right now. I am currently speechless...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-11T18:13:39Z" title="03/11/2015 06:13  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 11, 2015</time> by xenomorph555**
Now, this could send a Shenzhou to the Moon with an extra stage for a deceleration burn.
They need this launcher for Tiangong-2, don't they?

> 
> They need this launcher for Tiangong-2, don't they?

I think they do. Tiangong-2 is going to be much heavier than T-1. As far as I know.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-11T15:48:12Z" title="03/11/2015 03:48  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 11, 2015</time> by Reddragon**

> 
> They need this launcher for Tiangong-2, don't they?

No, T-2's going up on LM-7 or 2F. LM-5's needed for the MIR class station in 2018.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I think they do. Tiangong-2 is going to be much heavier than T-1.

It's actually only going to be slightly heavier, it's shell is the T-1 backup.
Operational, or another ground test vehicle?

> 
> Operational, or another ground test vehicle?

A functional ground test vehicle, they could fly it if they wanted to but their smart so they wont.
Image broken for me. Though I suspect it is because it is hosted in china and my country has some problems with that.

> 
> Image broken for me. Though I suspect it is because it is hosted in china and my country has some problems with that.

Changed it, any better?

Yeah, working now!

That thing is huge! Looks different than the wiki image I found, but probably just perspective and paintjob.

Erm...sorry, but it isn't very exciting picture. I'm sure LM-5 is an impressive rocket, but this photo certainly does not give it justice. That strange "fish-eye" perspective completely warps the image. I will hold my excitement until i see something more resembling a rocket than a misshaped pipe.

> 
> Erm...sorry, but it isn't very exciting picture. I'm sure LM-5 is an impressive rocket, but this photo certainly does not give it justice. That strange "fish-eye" perspective completely warps the image. I will hold my excitement until i see something more resembling a rocket than a misshaped pipe.

The reason for fish-eye is because the rocket is to large for the single shot. Also the reason it's "exciting" is because it's the first image of an assembled one. However a much better image would be it on the pad, so you are right there.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> than a misshaped pipe.

All rockets are pipes, plain and simple. Especially the Falcon-9 which people seem to fanboy over.

S..y Looking rocket. Looking forward to seeing her fly.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-12T02:36:18Z" title="03/12/2015 02:36  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 12, 2015</time> by Voidryder**
  
Censorship

> 
> All rockets are pipes, plain and simple. Especially the Falcon-9 which people seem to fanboy over.

Not for no reason though.

> 
> The reason for fish-eye is because the rocket is to large for the single shot. Also the reason it's "exciting" is because it's the first image of an assembled one. However a much better image would be it on the pad, so you are right there.
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> All rockets are pipes, plain and simple. Especially the Falcon-9 which people seem to fanboy over.

Rockets are cool, period! I don't care who launches them, as long as their intentions are peaceful and they forward the progress of space exploration rockets are amazing things.
